cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast just offshore the Southeast U.S. coast and forecast to accelerate northeastward along the Carolina coastline toward the Outer Banks tonight and Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina Outer Banks

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches in effect south of Savannah River; watches begin north of North Carolina/Virginia border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning extend from Savannah River northward to the NC/VA border (including entire Georgia-South Carolina coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia and South Carolina coasts, spreading northward through North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Only a small (6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts near 35–40 mph possible Thursday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels in the Savannah River and adjacent coast could reach 2–4 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide Thursday, producing minor port inundation.
weather_observation.rainfall: Expected rainfall around 1–2 inches—brief heavy squalls but widespread flooding not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; minor coastal erosion possible.
